```{r libaray, warning=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
```


```{r data import and cleaning na value}
data_counties <- read.csv("introdata_merged_counties.csv")
head(data_counties)
data_counties %>% drop_na()
```

```{r data set summary}
summary(data_counties)
```
```{r}
ggplot(data_counties, aes(x = bachelor_degree_numbers_2016_2020, y = per_capita_personal_income_2020 )) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Scatter Plot Example",
    x = "bachelor_degree_numbers_2016_2020",
    y = "per_capita_personal_income_2020" 
  ) 

ggplot(data_counties, aes(x = associate_degree_numbers_2016_2020 , y = per_capita_personal_income_2020 )) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Scatter Plot Example",
    x = "associate_degree_numbers_2016_2020",
    y = "per_capita_personal_income_2020"
  ) 

```

```{r scatter plot after exclude extrem value}
ggplot(data_counties, aes(x = bachelor_degree_numbers_2016_2020, y = per_capita_personal_income_2020 )) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Scatter Plot Example",
    x = "bachelor_degree_numbers_2016_2020",
    y = "per_capita_personal_income_2020" 
  ) + 
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, 150000))  + 
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 100000))


ggplot(data_counties, aes(x = associate_degree_numbers_2016_2020 , y = per_capita_personal_income_2020 )) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Scatter Plot Example",
    x = "associate_degree_numbers_2016_2020",
    y = "per_capita_personal_income_2020"
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, 150000))  +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 100000))

```
